page.title: 10TRANSPORT IN ROMSEY
page.content: The school is in a triangle between the A31 Winchester - New Forest road, the railway and the canal. The road to Winchester passes through Ampfield Woods belonging to the Bishop of Winchester until the 18th century when the road cut through the middle. Before it was a very windy road through Braishfield. We counted the traffic on this busy road over lots of five minutes (see charts 1 and 2). The railway goes east to west. On the east the railway splits one line crossing the road over an old bridge called the 'Sun Arch' after the inn.
